name: The Townhouse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an overnight stay during the "Rewind Festival" and from the minute I called to say when we would be arriving and if a taxi could be booked, the warm welcome and no problem attitude by our host David was second to none. Free parking and a great location and we had the top floor room which was spacious and tastefully decorated with lots of nice touches. I notice a reviewer had said it would have been nice to have ice with their water we certainly had a note next to our jug saying that ice etc could be brought up no problem, if requested along with fresh milk for tea/coffee. Loved the little petite fours and the room was very spacious with a huge bed; lovely en-suite bathroom which was immaculate with lovely fluffy towels. Breakfast in the morning was amazing and a relaxing affair with a great choice with fresh food home cooked which was delicious - loved the little dishes the condiments were on. We were sorry we were only staying one night as David made us feel so welcome and have definitely booked to go back for next year.
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Town House Boutique Bed and Breakfast in Perth proved to be the best of all the accommodation that was tried during our recent tour of Scotland.
reviews.title: Simply the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very spacious town house with views across the park, recently refurbished and tastefully furnished by the owners, it provided the perfect environment in which to enjoy the excellent service on offer.
reviews.title: Perth stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our hosts were at lengths to make our stay as comfortable as possible, and attention to detail was at the heart of their provision.
reviews.title: Style and comfort. A real gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the outset, nothing was left to chance. We were warmly greeted by David on our arrival, who not only showed us to our room, but kindly carried our luggage. Our room was first class in every way; clean and very spacious with classic furnishings and bone china crockery, quality linen on the king size bed, and a newly fitted en-suite shower room with luxury toiletries and fluffy towels.
reviews.title: Just Lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights whilst touring in the region. Great size room which was very clean with fresh flowers, complimentary goodies such as bottled water and excellent teas and biscuits. The en-suite bathroom was modern with a shower that knocked you off your feet. Private parking at the rear and a warm welcome from David makes for an excellent place to stay - especially as the rate we paid represented really good value for money. The only reason I cannot give 5 stars is the mattress - to say that it was firm would be a significant understatement.
reviews.title: Excellent choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: Needing somewhere for an overnight stay,I opted for The Townhouse based on the Tripadvisor reviews.and don't think I could have been better looked after anywhere.
reviews.title: Modern comfort combined with Georgian elegance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: .My room was as well furnished and equipped as many a 4/5/ star hotel ,the bed comfortable and the shower room a generous size,
reviews.title: Beautiful room with a lovely outlook.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013
reviews.text: The Townhouse has been skilfully modernised without losing the period charm, Breakfast was excellent and how civilised to have the butter and preserves presented on china dishes instead of the usual plastic pots!
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having to get ready for a wedding , there was the offer of ironing facilities and a taxi called. I couldn't fault the welcome or the service which was helpful and efficient without being obtrusive.. I very much hope tp return .
reviews.title: Oasis of calm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We spent our first night in Scotland at The Townhouse and it set the bar pretty high for other B&Bs. Free parking behind the building was a great convenience. David valiantly carried our luggage up to the third floor (one of us was traveling for a month and packed accordingly). We found beautiful fresh flowers in our large clean and well-lit room. The shower in the modern bathroom had plentiful hot water, great water pressure and high-end toiletries. Tea service in the room included fresh milk and biscuits. The Townhouse was within easy walking distance of several restaurants of various cuisines. Freshly cooked full Scottish breakfast included locally made jam and fresh fruit, and kept us till dinner. David was a charming and informative host, and we plan to return to The Townhouse next year for a longer stay.
reviews.title: We loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife has already left a review but as I chose this stop I feel I too can leave one. A stop to slightly extend a business trip for leisure. A huge grand bedroom with en-suite, excellent attentive and amusing service from owner, great full breakfast - would highly recommend.
reviews.title: Park and Walk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Expansive views over park and within easy walking distance, along the lovely riverside prom, of town centre and restaurants. If in Perth again would not hesitate to return.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a lovely weekend stay in The Townhouse.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: David & Laurent have an absolute gem on their hands and both were extremely welcoming. This Georgian Townhouse has very impressive & spacious rooms and is tastefully decorated to an exceedingly high standard.
reviews.title: Elegance and value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: After some unfortunate experiences, we generally avoid the word "quirky" when it comes to hotels. But if The Townhouse in Perth can be called quirky it is only in a very good way. First of all, the setting - overlooking the greenery of South Inch - could not have been better. It was easy to find, on the way in to Perth and with handy off-street parking in a private road around back. We came as a couple with our grown-up son, to spend a few days in Perth before moving on to other parts and were given two rooms at the top of the narrow 4-storey house (probably not ideal if you have mobility problems, but perfect for us). Lovely, clean, spacious rooms with everything you need, including a nice, big double bed and an efficient shower. And the breakfasts were something else - starting with a red fruit salad with mint (delicious) and then everything from cereals through to a full Scottish breakfast, done exactly - and deliciously - to your requirements. You must try the Stornoway black pudding - the best I've ever tasted. David could not have been a more attentive host and we had a thoroughly good stay.
reviews.title: A great little spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have just returned from a two night stay at the Townhouse , what a loverly place with a fantastic host (David). It was perfect just like home, if you happen to live in a spotlessly clean beautifully decorated, warm and welcoming home, where you are served a well cooked breakfast with good quality ingredients. I cannot recommend this place enough x
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a wonderful B&B. We just returned from spending 11 days in England and Scotland. We were traveling with friends and stayed in 5 different cities. The Townhouse was our favorite accommodation. Owners, David and Laurent, could not have been more accommodating. They gave us great recommendations for restaurants and served a delicious breakfast each morning. If you're planning a visit to Perth, definitely consider staying at this lovely B&B
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even before we arrived we received dedicated and welcoming service, as they sought to make sure they had the right food for a gluten free diet. This wonderful service and attention to detail was provided throughout our stay.
reviews.title: A special place in every way.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Attention to detail was also paid to the amazing decor in our room. It was absolutely stunning, a room we really wanted to spend time in - time to relax in beautiful surroundings. The bed was absolutely dreamy and we had such a wonderfully comfortable nights sleep.
reviews.title: SLEEPING IN A MUSEUM

description: The Townhouse, Perth was recently purchased by 2 professional hoteliers and completely refurbished to a high standard and offers a boutique style Bed & Breakfast.Situated very close to the town center and a few minutes from both the train and bus terminals.The Townhouse has a total of 5 luxury bedrooms including a large family room.An ideal spot for visiting tourists or an overnight stay in comfort.
